alert.note: Alert for Fremont; Harrison; Mills; Monona; Montgomery; Page; Pottawattamie; Shelby (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 3:45AM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, light snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of less than one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and west central Iowa and east central and southeast Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 7 PM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
